boardgame.name: El Capitán
エル・カピタン
boardgame.description: El Capit_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;n, a game that is based upon Tycoon but with many improvements and upgrades._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is now playable with 2-5 players (instead of 2-4); it has 11 new groundbreaking rules, and on top of it all, expansions and a whole new exciting look!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; All together we have now the following changes/improvements for the basic game:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; new grouping of the cities on the game board_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; new payout table for distribution_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 3 new Distribution Cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; new rules for the forts_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; start money is 20 florins instead of 15_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; place up 4 multi travel cards instead of 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; new rule for the loan cards (not allowed in the first round)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; new start player after a payday (a special start player figure is added)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; building up to 12 (instead of only 9) warehouses in a city_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; limitation of warehouses in series (limited to 3 now)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; a rule for the first warehouse in a city_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Also included is the first expansion _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Portuguese Powers_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; with some extra city boards and strategy!!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; There are now special rules for 2 or 3 players (extra renovation fields) and a special rule for 2 players (payday and additional warehouses)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game was published in October 2007 by QWG Games in the Benelux, by Pro Ludo in Germany, by Ystari Games in France, and by Z-Man Games in USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, UK, and Ireland._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

QWG Games - El Capitan Language: Dutch Players: 2 to 5 Age: 10+ Duration: about 75 min Weight: 1.270 kg New - mint condition - unopened - still in shrink wrap. Theme: #3 in the Master Print series. You are a reputable merchant in the 15th century, sailing to strategically important cities of the Mediterranean, building warehouses in these cities and fortresses to protect them. It is your ambition to become the most mighty and successful merchant of all. But you will succeed only if you manage to establish your warehouses in as many cities as possible and if you build your warehouses and fortresses in the most flourishing cities. The player owning the most money at the end of the game is the most renowned merchant and winner of the game. This game also comes with an expansion pack of 3 cities and a pirate ship. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.

This is the English language, Z-Man Games Edition. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s sealed in shrinkwrap. PLEASE NOTE: This is in _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;light ding and dent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; condition. There is an outward crease along the left edge of the box lid. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not sure whether it will be visible in the photo. This occurred when it was shipped to me by the original retailer, who did a sub-standard job packing an overstuffed much-too-large shipping box. Everything inside should be like a normal mint, sealed copy. The lid was not caved it nor is there anything that would suggest any damage could have occurred to the components. Shipping: I use regional rate boxes that make it extremely cheap ($7-$9) to ship most games within several states of me in Minnesota. At worst you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll pay Flat Rate Priority (for games that fit). *MUST READ* PAYMENT INFO: I take USPS Money Orders or well-concealed cash. I accept standard Paypal _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Goods Purchase_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; payments, but your grand total will suffice to make me _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;whole_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; after Paypal takes their fees out, which are $0.30 + 2.9% of the transferred amount. I also am happy to take ZERO-FEE _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; PAYPAL payments that use a bank account or your existing Paypal balance as the payment source (NOT a credit card, unless you pick the option to pay the fees yourselves) for the exact sale price plus exact postage. To make a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Personal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Paypal payment, you: Log in to your Paypal account, click _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Send Money_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, then choose the option of send money to friends and family, NOT to purchase goods. Make sure your source of funds is either your bank account or your paypal account balance. (If you use a credit card, you must select the option to pay the fees.)

The game itself is in very good condition. However this is a former World Boardgaming Championships gaming library item which was sold through the WBC Game auction in 2013, where I purchased it. They mark their library games with stickers saying, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Property of..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and they then cover those stickers with another saying _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Sold at the WBC auction_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. So there are a few of these stickers on the outside of the box. So this is obvisouly a gamers copy, not a collectors copy which is why I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m selling it cheaply.
Still sealed! And this is the Quined Games Master Print Edition! Grab it while you can...it probably won_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t last long!
